meanings.definition: A person in charge of a sacristy.
meanings.sent1: The sacristan unlocked the sacristy to prepare for the church service.
meanings.sent2: The sacristan organized the items in the sacristy neatly.
meanings.sent3: The sacristan accidentally locked themselves in the sacristy and had to call for help.
meanings.sent4: The sacristan's dedication to the sacristy was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The sacristan's role as the guardian of the sacristy was crucial for the church.

meanings.definition: A church official responsible for the care of sacred vessels and vestments.
meanings.sent1: The sacristan carefully polished the sacred vessels in the church.
meanings.sent2: The sacristan ensured the vestments were clean and ready for the priest.
meanings.sent3: The sacristan jokingly pretended to wear the sacred vestments as a costume.
meanings.sent4: The sacristan's love for the sacred vessels was evident in their meticulous care.
meanings.sent5: The sacristan's attention to detail in handling the sacred vessels was admirable.

meanings.definition: A layperson who assists in the preparation of the church for religious services.
meanings.sent1: The sacristan helped set up the church for the Sunday service.
meanings.sent2: The sacristan lit the candles before the religious service began.
meanings.sent3: The sacristan playfully raced against time to finish preparing the church.
meanings.sent4: The sacristan's dedication to assisting in church preparations was commendable.
meanings.sent5: The sacristan's role as a helper in church services was appreciated by all.
